## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
AI Assistant: Hi there! I'm here to help with any questions or concerns you might have. Please, feel free to ask anything you need help with.
User: Hey, I was trying to do something with my Verus Desktop wallet but got stuck. What should I do before importing a single WIF for a private address in Verus Desktop?
AI Assistant: That's a great question! Before importing a single WIF for a private address in Verus Desktop, go to `settings` --> `Coin Settings`, select the chain you want to use in the top-right corner and ensure you have the actual **wif** you got from the `convertpassphrase` command earlier. This is a crucial step before importing any WIFs. Are there any other questions I can help you with?
User: Thanks, that's very helpful! And a follow-up question: What is the command to import a single WIF for a private address in the Verus Desktop GUI wallet?
AI Assistant: Glad to be of assistance! The command to import a single WIF for a private address in the Verus Desktop GUI wallet is: `run z_importkey \"<wif>\" \"yes\" 1`. Remember to replace `<wif>` with the actual WIF you got from the `convertpassphrase` command earlier. Also, note that you should not use the WIF from the example above, but use the one from the CLI-interface in Verus Desktop. Do you need any more help with this?
User: Yes, I have a few more WIFs to import. How do I import multiple WIFs in one batch for private addresses in Verus Desktop?
AI Assistant: To import multiple WIFs in one batch for private addresses in Verus Desktop, go to `settings` --> `Coin Settings`, select the chain you want to use in the top-right corner and enter the specific command for every WIF except for the final one, and then import the final WIF with a different command that triggers the chain to rescan all addresses in your wallet. This way you can import multiple WIFs at once. I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

What should you do before importing a single WIF for a private address in Verus Desktop?

Before importing a single WIF for a private address in Verus Desktop, go to `settings` --> `Coin Settings`, select the chain you want to use in the top-right corner and ensure you have the actual **wif** you got from the `convertpassphrase` command earlier.

The GUI wallet will not show any progress on the import and may give messages that the RPC daemon is not reacting. It will take quite some time for the process to finish in the background, especially if the address has many transaction on it. ## Importing a single WIF for a private address To import your address, go to `settings` --> `Coin Settings`, select the chain you want to use in the top-right corner and enter the following command: ``` run z_importkey "<wif>" "yes" 1 ``` Replace `<wif>` with the actual **wif** you got from the `convertpassphrase` command earlier. Note: Don't use the WIF from the example above, but use the one from the CLI-interface in Verus Desktop. The GUI wallet will not show any progress on the import and may give messages that the RPC daemon is not reacting. It will take quite some time for the process to finish in the background, especially if the address has many transaction on it. ## Importing multiple WIFs in one batch for private addresses To import your address, go to `settings` --> `Coin Settings`, select the chain you want to use in the top-right corner and enter the following command for every WIF except for the final one: ``` run z_importkey "<wif>" "no" ``` Import the final WIF with this command: ``` run z_importkey "<wif>" "yes" 1 ``` The last command triggers the chain to rescan all addresses in your wallet, including all the addresses you just imported. Replace `<wif>` with the actual **wif** (like the one you got from the `convertpassphrase` command earlier).
What is the command to import a single WIF for a private address in the Verus Desktop GUI wallet?

The command to import a single WIF for a private address in the Verus Desktop GUI wallet is: `run z_importkey \"<wif>\" \"yes\" 1`. Replace `<wif>` with the actual WIF you got from the `convertpassphrase` command earlier. Note: Don't use the WIF from the example above, but use the one from the CLI-interface in Verus Desktop.

The GUI wallet will not show any progress on the import and may give messages that the RPC daemon is not reacting. It will take quite some time for the process to finish in the background, especially if the address has many transaction on it. ## Importing a single WIF for a private address To import your address, go to `settings` --> `Coin Settings`, select the chain you want to use in the top-right corner and enter the following command: ``` run z_importkey "<wif>" "yes" 1 ``` Replace `<wif>` with the actual **wif** you got from the `convertpassphrase` command earlier. Note: Don't use the WIF from the example above, but use the one from the CLI-interface in Verus Desktop. The GUI wallet will not show any progress on the import and may give messages that the RPC daemon is not reacting. It will take quite some time for the process to finish in the background, especially if the address has many transaction on it. ## Importing multiple WIFs in one batch for private addresses To import your address, go to `settings` --> `Coin Settings`, select the chain you want to use in the top-right corner and enter the following command for every WIF except for the final one: ``` run z_importkey "<wif>" "no" ``` Import the final WIF with this command: ``` run z_importkey "<wif>" "yes" 1 ``` The last command triggers the chain to rescan all addresses in your wallet, including all the addresses you just imported. Replace `<wif>` with the actual **wif** (like the one you got from the `convertpassphrase` command earlier).
